JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Stanislav Shevchuk
TEXT: The applicant , ORG , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr Y. GPE .

On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings in the Dzerzhynsky District Court of ORG against a ORG company , Kharkivsadvinprom , challenging her dismissal on the grounds of redundancy from the position of dispatcher and seeking reinstatement and compensation for wrongful dismissal . She alleged , inter alia , that at the material time the position of senior financial controller ( ведучий економіст-ревізор ) was vacant , and the defendant was obliged under the applicable law to offer it to the applicant .
DATE the court listed CARDINAL hearings . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned since the applicant failed to appear , CARDINAL hearing was adjourned since the both parties failed to appear .
On DATE the court left the applicant ’s claims without consideration . In DATE the applicant lodged an appeal against this ruling .
On DATE the ORG quashed the ruling of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case to the first instance court .

DATE and DATE the first instance court listed some CARDINAL hearings . QUANTITY hearings were adjourned since the applicant failed to appear . CARDINAL hearing was adjourned since the judge was involved in other proceedings .

On DATE the court ruled against the applicant , finding her dismissal lawful . The court observed , in particular , that the applicant ’s qualifications were insufficient to fill the position of senior financial controller . The applicant appealed in cassation .

On DATE the ORG allowed the applicant ’s cassation appeal and remitted the case for fresh consideration . The court found that the first - instance court had not sufficiently investigated the applicant ’s eligibility for the vacant position . The proceedings were transferred to ORG .

DATE and DATE the first instance court listed CARDINAL hearings . CARDINAL hearing was adjourned since the applicant was ill , CARDINAL due to the applicant ’s request for adjournment . CARDINAL hearing was adjourned since the defendant ’s representative failed to appear .

On DATE ORG of ORG reinstated the applicant and partly allowed her compensation claims , having found that the applicant was sufficiently qualified to fill the vacant position of senior financial controller and that the defendant had wrongly failed to offer her this option . The defendant appealed in cassation .

On DATE the ORG quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case for fresh consideration , having found that the first - instance court had insufficiently investigated whether the applicant ’s qualifications made her eligible for the vacant position .

DATE , CARDINAL hearings were listed by the first instance court . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned due to the applicant ’s failure to appear , CARDINAL due to the applicant ’s request for adjournment , CARDINAL due to the absence of the applicant ’s representative appointed ex officio . These adjournments caused a delay of DATE .

CARDINAL hearings were adjourned because the judge was involved in other proceedings , CARDINAL because of the judge ’s illness , CARDINAL because the judge was on leave , and one because he was travelling on official business . CARDINAL hearings were adjourned due to the defendant representative ’s failure to appear . These adjournments caused a delay of DATE . Most of the hearings in the applicant ’s case were scheduled by the first instance court at intervals from DATE .

On DATE the amendments to LAW entered into force . They provided a right to lodge a cassation appeal within DATE period with ORG of GPE against court decisions adopted before DATE and which had entered into force before that date . Accordingly , in DATE , while the proceedings before the first instance court were still pending , the applicant lodged an application with ORG of GPE seeking annulment of the ruling of ORG of DATE . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal in cassation .
On DATE the ORG of Kharkiv dismissed the applicant ’s claims . On DATE the ORG upheld this judgment . The applicant appealed in cassation before ORG .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for leave to appeal in cassation .

In DATE the applicant requested ORG of Kharkiv to quash the judgment of DATE in the light of newly discovered circumstances . On DATE the court refused to grant the applicant ’s request . On DATE and DATE ORG and ORG , respectively , upheld this ruling .

The applicant complained under LAW that the length of proceedings in her case was excessive . She further complained that the proceedings were unfair , notably because free legal aid had not been made available to her and the merits of her claims had been dismissed .
